mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Ralph Bunche on integration : U.N. official says major breakthrough approaching : interview, the Courier-Journal, Louisville, Ky

mods:mods.mods:note: Newspaper article, topped by a 13 x 24 cm. photograph with the caption: "Scenes like this from Birmingham, with police dogs used against negro demonstrators, have caused "very bad reactions" in Asia, Africa and Europe, says Ralph Bunche, Negro United Nations undersecretary, Bunche believes the situation climaxes a long struggle". Article also includes a photograph of Ralph Bunche with the caption : Ralph J. Bunche "Built-in impatience". Also includes a political cartoon by Justus, Minneapolis Star, with the caption: Extra! Extra! U.S. Race Riots All About the Race Riots in America

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Ralph J. Bunche confers with President Makarios

mods:mods.mods:note: On verso of photograph: UN 84460, Nicosia, Cyprus, 8 April 1964. Ralph J. Bunche, Under-Secretary for Special Political Affairs, met with President Makarios on 8 April 1964, during his visit to Cyprus. Mr. Bunche visited Cyprus in the course of a routine visit to study the problems and needs of the United Nations truce supervision and peace force operations in Gaza, Cyprus and Kashmir on instructions from the Secretary-General. The missions include the United Nations Emergency Force (UNEF), the United Nations Force in Cyprus (UNFICYP) and the United Nations Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan (UNMOGIP). Includes the following description of photograph: Dr. Ralph J. Bunche (left) Under-Secretary for Special Political Affairs, conferring with Archbishop Makarios, President of the Republic of Cyprus, in the Presidential Palace in Nicosia

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ralph J. Bunche confers with President Makarios
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On verso of photograph: UN 84460, Nicosia, Cyprus, 8 April 1964. Ralph J. Bunche, Under-Secretary for Special Political Affairs, met with President Makarios on 8 April 1964, during his visit to Cyprus. Mr. Bunche visited Cyprus in the course of a routine visit to study the problems and needs of the United Nations truce supervision and peace force operations in Gaza, Cyprus and Kashmir on instructions from the Secretary-General. The missions include the United Nations Emergency Force (UNEF), the United Nations Force in Cyprus (UNFICYP) and the United Nations Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan (UNMOGIP). Includes the following description of photograph: Dr. Ralph J. Bunche (left) Under-Secretary for Special Political Affairs, conferring with Archbishop Makarios, President of the Republic of Cyprus, in the Presidential Palace in Nicosia
